alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 7:39PM EST until January 12 at 7:49AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Dinwiddie and Brunswick Counties. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Rawlings. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water begins to flow across Harpers Bridge Road about an 1/8 of a mile north of the river. Farm land north of river along Beaver Pond Creek also floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:20 PM EST Thursday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:20 PM EST Thursday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 03/31/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 745 AM EST.
